intro: Tessenia ramosa, commonly known as the branching tessenia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, star-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to withstand high temperatures and low rainfall. Its flowers, which range in color from yellow to red, bloom during the cooler months, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Tessenia ramosa is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
